register.description: contains bits related to control of terminations in USB2PHY

bitfield.description: When set to ‘1’, the calibration code is updated immediately after a code computation without waiting for idle periods.
Rterm calibration is done. 1st time cal is done this bit gets set and gets reset at a restart cal.Read value is valid only if VDDLDO is on.
FS Code selection control
Override termination resistor trim code with RTERM_RMX from this register

When read, this field returns the current Termination resistor trim code.Read value is valid only if VDDLDO is on. The value written to this field is used as Termination resistor trim code if bit 21 is set to ‘1’
HS Code selection control. Each increment increases the termination impedance by ~1.5%. Valid values are 000b–011b.
Master loop comparator output. Read value is valid only if VDDLDO is on.
Restart the rterm calibration. The calibration restarts on any toggle 0 to 1 or 1 to 0 on this bit.
Disables the temperature tracking function of the termination calibration
when '1' the rterm cal code is overridden by values in RTERM_CAL

When read this field returns the current rterm calibration code. Read value is valid only if VDDLDO is on. The value written to this field is used as rterm calibration code if the bit USE_RTERM_CAL_REG is 1.

register.description: Contains bits related to RX calibration

bitfield.description: Restart the HSRX calibration state machine when this bit goes from 0 to 1.
Override HS offset correction with HS_OFF_CODE when set to '1'
HS offset code, this code is forced when bit 30 is ‘1’. Code is updated from calibration logic when bit 30 = 0.
The output of the HSRX comparator.Read value is valid only if VDDLDO is on.
Signal that indicates that the HSRX calibration is done. This gets reset at every restart.Read value is valid only if VDDLDO is on.
Override Squelch offset DAC1 code when '1'
When read returns current Sq offset code for DAC1, if VDDLDO is on. When written this is used as Sq offset code for DAC1 when USE_SQ_OFF_DAC1 = '1'
Override Squelch offset DAC2 code when '1'
When read returns current Sq offset code for DAC2, if VDDLDO is on. When written this is used as Sq offset code for DAC2 when USE_SQ_OFF_DAC2 = '1'
Override Squelch offset DAC3 code when '1'
When read returns current Sq offset code for DAC3, if VDDLDO is on. When written this is used as Sq offset code for DAC3 when USE_SQ_OFF_DAC3 = '1'
Sq comp output.Read value is valid only if VDDLDO is on.
Sq calibration is done when this bit = 1. see RESTART_SQ_CAL for more description.Read value is valid only if VDDLDO is on.
the squelch calibration continuously goes through restart cycles when this bit is ‘1’. i.e. restarts waits for done – then restarts again etc.

register.description: the 2nd DLLHS control register. bits 4:0 are unrelated to the DLLHS and are linestate filter settings

bitfield.description: See DFT spec for details
See DFT spec for details
Enables the linestate debounce filter
Used for control of the linestate debounce filter when going from syncronous to async linestate.
Swaps the dataout from HSOS
Inverts the HSOS bits
This inverts the phase for the PHYCLKOUT
Flags if the RX data packet has PID error. NOT IMPLEMENTED YET
This will bypass the analog and will send data packet to controller incase of receiver (Faking the receive data). data used will be INTDATAOUTREG
This register will be loaded through OCP and this data will be given to the controller if USEINTDATAOUT is set to ‘1’
CDR debug bits. Read value is valid only if VDDLDO is on. see DFT spec for details

register.description: this is the charger detect register. this register is not used in the dead battery case.

bitfield.description: Use bits 28-24 and 18-17 from this register
When read, returns current value of charger detect input. When USE_CHG_DET_REG = ‘1’, the value written to this field overrides the corresponding charger detect input.
When read, returns current value of charger detect input. When USE_CHG_DET_REG = ‘1’, the value written to this field overrides the corresponding charger detect input.
When read, returns current value of charger detect input. When USE_CHG_DET_REG = ‘1’, the value written to this field overrides the corresponding charger detect input.
When read, returns current value of charger detect input. When USE_CHG_DET_REG = ‘1’, the value written to this field overrides the corresponding charger detect input.
Restart the charger detection protocol when this goes from 0 to 1
Charger detect protocol has completed
Same signal as CE
Output of the data det comparator
When read, returns current value of charger detect input. When USE_CHG_DET_REG = ‘1’, the value written to this field overrides the corresponding charger detect input.
When read, returns current value of charger detect input. When USE_CHG_DET_REG = ‘1’, the value written to this field overrides the corresponding charger detect input.
Comparator on the DP line value
Comparator on the DM line value
Charger detect osc control
Charger detect timer control. See charger detect section for details
Charger detect current control
Charger detect voltage buffer control
Force CE = ‘1’ when this bit is set

register.description: has all the power control bits

bitfield.description: Goes high when the RESET is synchronized to TCLK
Goes high when LDO domain is up and PLL LOCK is available and utmi_reset is de-asserted.
Goes high when LDO domain is up and PLL LOCK is available.
Goes high when the RESET is synchronized to MCLK
Goes high when the RESET is synchronized to charger detect oscillator clock domain
This is the value of the counter used for LDO power up. RESET to default.
Forces the PLL to the slow clk mode
Forces the LDO to be ON.
Forces the PLL to be ON.
Lock signal from the PLL
This signal is used to indicate to the Phy, not to do any clock related activity until PLLLOCK = ‘1’.This is not the default option.0 – do not use PLLLOCK. 1 – use PLLLOCK as a clock gate.
1 -> use bit 3 as override for the DATAPOLARITYN signal.
Override value of datapolarityn
Use bit 1 from this register as PD override when set to '1'
Override value for PD

register.description: register to override UTMI interface control pins.

bitfield.description: Use datain from UTMI interface register
Override value for the UTMIDATAIN
When set to ‘1’ use bit 12 from register instead of interface
Override value for UTMI signal DATABUS16OR8
When set to ‘1’ use bit 10-9 from register instead of interface
Override value for UTMI signal OPMODE[1:0]
Override the suspend and reset values. Use bits 6 and 7
Override value for UTMI signal SUSPENDM
Override value for UTMI signal UTMIRESET
When set to ‘1’ use bit 4-3 from register instead of interface
Override value for UTMI signal XCVRSEL[1:0]
When set to ‘1’ use bit 1-0 from register instead of interface
Override value for UTMI signal TXVALID
Override value for UTMI signal TXVALIDH

Read for UTMI signal.Read value is valid only if VDDLDO is on.

When set to ‘1’ use bits 18-17 from register instead of interface

-When set to ‘1’ use bits 15-13 from register instead of interface

If the suspend signal is asserted for very short-time, it is pulse extended so that all the sampling logic samples it reliably. This pulse extention can be bypassed by writin a '1' to this bit ( so that IP's behaviour is similar to previous versions)

register.description: COntains bits related to the built in self test of the phy

bitfield.description: When set to ‘1’ the BIST mode is started.
When ‘1’ the TX swing is reduced in BIST mode
Enables CRC calculation during BIST when set to ‘1’
Address for which BIST to select
Enables the loopback mode
Selects which phase to use for data transmission during BIST
Enables freq sweep on CDR
Selects the freq sweep mode. Details in DFT spec.
Indicates that the BIST has passed. Read value is valid only if VDDLDO is on.
Indicates that BIST is running. Read value is valid only if VDDLDO is on.
Defined in DFT spec
Defined in DFT spec
Defined in DFT spec
Defined in DFT spec
When set to ‘1’ bits 18-16 are activated for choosing the transmitting phase.

register.description: the CRC code for BIST test

bitfield.description: The CRC value from the BIST.

register.description: Config and status register for the USB2PHYCM and LDO

bitfield.description: Connects to the CONFIGURECM pins. see DFT spec for details.
Reads the CMSTATUS bits. see DFT spec for details.
The LDOCONFIG bit settings. See DFT spec for details.
Reads the LDOSTATUS bits. see DFT spec for details.

register.description: All bits (unless defined) are bypass bits for internal analog to digital interface pins with the same name. All the bits of this register, except the over-ride bits return a '0' on read, if VDDLDO is off.

bitfield.description: Override for bits 30-29
Override for bits 27-25
Override for bits 23-19
Override for bits 17-16
Override for bits 14 – 12
Override for bits 10 – 8
Override for bits 6
Use bit 2 for this reg

register.description: All bits (unless defined) are bypass bits for internal analog to digital interface pins with the same name. All the bits of this register, except the over-ride bits return a '0' on read, if VDDLDO is off.

bitfield.description: Use bits 27-30 from this register as overrides
Use bits 24-25 from this register as override
Use bit 14 from this register as override
Use override from bits 7-12
Read only bit -> the PORZ generated from the digital registered on the A-D interface.

register.description: All bits (unless defined) are bypass bits for internal analog to digital interface pins with the same name. All the bits of this register, except the over-ride bits return a '0' on read, if VDDLDO is off.

bitfield.description: Use bits 30-23 in this register as bypass bits
Use bits 20-21 as bypass bits
Use bit 18 as override bit
Use bit 0 from this register as bypass

register.description: Used to configure and debug the analog blocks.

bitfield.description: 0000000b - Produces the typical vertical eye diagram amplitude (default). 1100000b - Increases vertical eye diagram amplitude by 15 mV. 1010000b - Decreases vertical eye diagram amplitude by 15 mV. All other values are reserved.

000b - Typical termination impedance (default). 011b - Decreases the termination impedance by 2 to 3% and can be used to increase the vertical eye diagram amplitude by 1 to 1.5%. All other values reserved.
